intro: Rhaphidospora medullosa, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a primitive vascular plant that belongs to the order Lepidoziales. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and a distinctive, branching stem structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Rhaphidospora medullosa reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. This ancient plant provides insight into the evolutionary development of early land plants.
